Key Match Events: Manny Machado started a game-ending triple play
Miguel Rojas hit a sharp grounder to Machado at third base, resulting in a triple play that ended the game
Post-Match Reflections: The second-place Padres have won four in a row and nine of 10.
San Diego’s four runs came with two outs in front of 50,369 fans who created a playoff atmosphere for the opener of the huge three-game series.
How much better in a tough spot than with Ohtani in the on-deck circle we turn a triple play to end the game against one of the best teams in baseball?
We’re going to enjoy tonight, enjoy this game, enjoy the celebration
The Dodgers’ magic number remained four to clinch the division title.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Machado made a heck of a play
Cronenworth had no RBIs in September until producing three against the Padres’ biggest rivals
San Diego extended its lead to 4-1 in the fourth on Xander Bogaerts’ RBI single and Cronenworth’s RBI double
The Dodgers got on the board in the first on Bogaerts’ throwing error at shortstop that scored Ohtani
